1:
God, do not be silent!\q Do not ignore us and remain unmoved, God.
\q
2:
Look, your enemies are making a commotion,\q and those who hate you have raised their heads.


\q
3:
They conspire against your people\q and plan together against your protected ones.
\q
4:
They have said, "Come, and let us destroy them as a nation.\q Then the name of Israel will no longer be remembered."
\q
5:
They have schemed together with one strategy;\q against you they have made an alliance.


\q
6: This includes the tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites,\q and the people of Moab and the Hagrites, who plot together with
7:
Gebal, Ammon, Amalek;\q it also includes Philistia and the inhabitants of Tyre.


\q
8:
Assyria also is allied with them;\q they are helping the descendants of Lot.
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
9:
Do to them as you did to Midian,\q as you did to Sisera and to Jabin at the Kishon River.
\q
10:
They perished at Endor\q and became like manure for the earth.


\q
11:
Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb,\q and all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna.
\q
12:
They said, "Let us take for ourselves\q the pastures of God."


\q
13:
My God, make them like the whirling dust,\q like chaff before the wind,
\q
14:
like the fire that burns the forest,\q and like the flame that sets the mountains on fire.
\q
15:
Chase them with your strong wind,\q and terrify them with your windstorm.


\q
16:
Fill their faces with shame\q so that they might seek your name, Yahweh.
\q
17:
May they be put to shame and be terrified forever;\q may they perish in disgrace.


\q
18: Then they will know that you alone, Yahweh,\q are the Most High over all the earth.
